result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sara M Scharlau

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:43 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Sara M Scharlau in court.  Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court for Sara M Scharlau.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Singleton provides an update; he has an offer but is trying to work with the State to resolve the matter in a non-criminal way.  Atty. Singleton is requesting a plea and sentencing date in about 30 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:14 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sara M Scharlau in court.  Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court for Sara M Scharlau.  Atty. Singleton provides an update, he is still in negotiations with the ADA assigned to the case and needs more time to discuss a resolution.  Atty. Singleton requests a further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:17 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary Caitlin Brejcha in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sara M Scharlau appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Justin L. Singleton appeared by Zoom for Sara M Scharlau.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Waive reading of Information.  Attorney Singleton stands mute on a plea.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Request for adjournment
**Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 08-09-2022. "Matter remains on for scheduling as a status on Prelim. Marsy's Law issue but victim notified, time limits previously waived. Defendant and defense counsel may appear by fully functioning Zoom or in person."
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Preliminary hearing on August 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Kohl's Department Store listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:18 AM Defendant Sara M Scharlau in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:15 am.
